name: Timescale
description: This Test Connection validates the access against the TimescaleDB database and basic metadata extraction of schemas, tables, and hypertables.

steps.name: CheckAccess
steps.description: Validate that we can properly reach the database and authenticate with the given credentials.
steps.errorMessage: Failed to connect to TimescaleDB, please validate the credentials

steps.name: GetDatabases
steps.description: List all the databases available to the user.
steps.errorMessage: Failed to fetch databases, please validate if the user has enough privilege to fetch databases.

steps.name: GetSchemas
steps.description: List all the schemas available to the user.
steps.errorMessage: Failed to fetch schemas, please validate if the user has enough privilege to fetch schemas.

steps.name: GetTables
steps.description: From a given schema, list the tables belonging to that schema. If no schema is specified, we'll list the tables of a random schema.
steps.errorMessage: Failed to fetch tables, please validate if the user has enough privilege to fetch tables.

steps.name: GetViews
steps.description: From a given schema, list the views belonging to that schema. If no schema is specified, we'll list the tables of a random schema.
steps.errorMessage: Failed to fetch views, please validate if the user has enough privilege to fetch views.

steps.name: GetTags
steps.description: Check if we can access pg_policy, pg_class & pg_namespace tables to get the policy tags attached to tables.
steps.errorMessage: Failed to fetch policy tags, please validate if the user has at least select privileges for pg_policy, pg_class & pg_namespace tables.

steps.name: GetQueries
steps.description: Check if we can access the pg_stat_statements table to get query logs, These queries are analyzed in the usage & lineage workflow.
steps.errorMessage: Failed to fetch queries, please validate if TimescaleDB instance has pg_stat_statements extension installed and the user has at least select privileges for pg_stat_statements table.
